author: djrtwo
content:
If you strictly follow the instructions in the v-guide, it'll give you what you need

so during epoch 0:

`source = latest_justified_checkpoint` -- which at the start of the chain as `epoch == 0` and `root == 0x00`

`target = Checkpoint(epoch=get_current_epoch(head_state), root=epoch_boundary_block_root)` so `epoch == 0` and `root = hash_tree_root(genesis_block)`

author: djrtwo
content:
.
whereas in epoch 1, the justified checkpoint might be updated with the _real_ root of epoch 0 (as opposed to `0x00`) but still you just follow the instructions and it'll work out

author: djrtwo
content:
.
and yes, essentially at genesis epoch, you are pointing source and target to the same place. It, in effect, does nothing wrt justified/fnialized checkpoints, but the attestations in genesis epoch are important to GHOST/forkchoice
